textBeforeTable: Radiology Salary in Utah If you are thinking of pursuing a radiology degree in Utah, you have the option of pursuing a certificate, associates, or bachelors degree. The most popular route to an entry level job in radiology is to complete an associates degree. Upon completion, you will want to become certified through the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists and become licensed to work in the state. You can start by requesting information from schools below. Becoming a Radiology Tech in Utah starts with getting a formal education in radiologic sciences. Radiologic Technologists are tasked with capturing images of the body using cutting edge technology to be used in the process of diagnosis. The job outlook for radiology workers in Utah is significantly higher than the national average. Rad Tech jobs are expected to grow by 29% over the next five years, according to the US Bureau of Labor Statistics, while related positions such as Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are expected to grow by 33%. Nuclear Medicine Tech positions are expected to grow by 28%. These figures are significantly higher than in most states, which means there is exceptionally high demand in the state of Utah.
